Name.BusinessNameLine1: Lutheran Social Services Disaster Response Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Our mission is to provide help, healing and hope in the name of Jesus Christ.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Our Mission is to provide help, healing and hope in the name of Jesus Christ.
IRS990.Description: We work closely with local, state and federal authorities, local relief groups and congregations to contribute to the development of efficient and effective long-term recovery efforts for hurricane and other disaster affected survivors.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Lutheran Social Service Disaster Response, Inc. is a wholly owned affiliate of Lutheran Social Services of the South, Inc. On April 1, 2009 LSS-DR adopted the provision under ASC Topic 740, Income Taxes, that clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an entity's financial statements and prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for financial statement disclosure of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. LSS-DR evaluates uncertain tax positions, if any exist, under this provision. LSSS accounts for uncertainty of income taxes based on a "more-likely-than-not" threshold for the recognition and de-recognition of tax positions, which includes the accounting for interest and penalties relating to tax positions. At the adoption, there was no liability for uncertain tax positions due to the fact that LSS-DR's federal income tax status was not considered an uncertain tax position. LSS-DR currently does not have any tax positions that it would consider uncertain at March 31, 2010.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Assistance provided to Hurricane Katrina / Rita Survivors

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Assistance provided to Hurricane Katrina/Rita Survivors - LSSDR case managers and sub-recipient entities conducted intake/eligibility determination and needs assessment interviews to determine the unmet needs of individuals impacted by 2005 Hurricanes Katrina and Rita. The final distribution of LSSDR funds were distributed as final home repairs were completed. Assistance provided to 2008 Hurricane Ike Survivors - LSSDR worked on site in Galveston County after the 2008 hurricanes assessing client need. Utilizing funding via a federal grant, LSSDR provided case management assistance to families living in several Texas counties who were impacted by Hurricane Ike. Funding via a second federal grant, allowed LSSDR to also provided direct financial assistance for unmet needs to families impacted by Hurricane Ike. Services including replacing furniture and appliances, and providing rental and utility assistance. Assistance provided to Texas Farmers - For Farm Aid direct assistance, an application is completed by rural and farm families. Written materials, references and/or follow-up field interviews are conducted to ensure that funds, averaging $300-$500 per household, are expended for household needs, such as mortgage, utilities, food, medical needs or prescriptions, etc. General grants have been purposed for farmers affected by any emergency or natural disaster, such as drought, or more specifically for farmers affected by Hurricanes Rita, Katrina, and Ike.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Either at a special meeting of the board or at the closest board meeting to the filing, the board will review the 990 in detail and approve for filing. All actions will be documented in the related board meeting minutes.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each board member, officer and key employee signs annually the conflict of interest policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Lutheran Social Services Disaster Relief, Inc. uses the following process to establish the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer: The Chair of the board of directors, on an annual basis, appoints a Personnel Committee, comprised of five members of the board of directors. None of these members has a "conflict of interest" as defined in the instructions to Part VI, Form 990. The Personnel Committee votes unanimously to approve the compensation arrangements. The details of such arrangements are also shared with the full board of directors. The committee uses a wide range of data as to comparable compensation for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations in establishing compensation for the CEO. This data includes not-for-profit organizations, including other Lutheran organizations, charities, foundations, associations, higher education, governmental, and health care services.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The entity makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policies and financial statements available upon request.

The company was audited by an independent auditing firm who issued a "Report on Compliance with Requirements Applicable to Each Major Program and on Internal Control over Compliance in Accordance with OMB Circular A-133 and on the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards" with related financial statements and disclosures.
